author: PRIYAM MUKHERJEE
comment: Calories are not showing up in the latest update...please fix the issues  ( Since they are working on the bug fixes , given it 3 ). But it desrves 5 once all is working fine , love the way it looks.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Priyam.  We've just released an update for the Colours and currently working on a calories bug fix - please watch out for this soon.

author: Stanley M
comment: Such a great WF design. Just need some tweaks to make it perfect. Make it able to setting inside AW app, time interval weather update, add screen time and if possible add step counter. And please improve phone battery update (it's important to me). Thanks. ***Edited 02/18, please fix green colour on widget 1 and 2. Now it just black. And also improve refresh phone battery status! Thanks.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Stanley, This issue has now been fixed, please do let us know if you continue to experience trouble.

author: Steve Mi
comment: Update- thanks for fixing all my issues. Now it's back to being the best watch face around.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Steve, we've fixed the colour issue, please watch out for the update.

author: rob p
comment: Hate that the settings have been taken off the phone on put on the watch...very hard to customise now

author: Thomas Urgento
comment: The new update has seemed to fix all of the issues I was having. thank you.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Thomas, Great thanks for the update!

author: MOHAMMED ALMARZOUQI
comment: Bad update can not even change screen color.., the same still can't change the screen color.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Mohammed, we've just launched a fix for this - please watch out for an update

author: Aaron Zeller
comment: The best watch face. Easy to read at a glance and shows all the information I need. Only wish you could adjust the time-out for the screen.

author: Walt Cooley
comment: Looks great, but the phone battery indicator and widgets don't actually connect to my phone which really sucks

author: Ben Miller
comment: Thanks to its update to AW2.0, it's back to its best. Thanks, Dev :)

author: Rob Fike
comment: I don't like the latest update.  This should get changed back.  I can't even find where to change the watch face settings on my moto 360.  I lowered the score of this app 2 stars because of this.  It will get lowered more if this doesn't get resolved.  Then eventually this app will get removed.  Adjusting the watch face settings was better on the phone.  Now it is buried in some watch menu.  Terrible decision.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Rob, we were forced to move the menu system as the Google design rules now mean that the watch face has to be able to be operated without a phone connection. We've improved the menu layout from our earlier version, and looking to see how we can improve it even more.

author: Nate W Thibodeau
comment: The Color settings need fixing. U have to click to the right of the color to set it. There is no slider or indicator next to it. In Widget Color settings, Green is actually black. Screen color should be titled Line Color. Also, its spelled "color" not "colour". Watch face looks awesome on OLED.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Nate, we've fixed the colour issue so please watch out for the update.

author: Peter Gary
comment: App was perfect till last update now totally unusable

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Peter, can you you let us know which aspects are broken so we can resolve them?  Can you drop us an emil to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk. Thanks.

author: Paul Alviz
comment: Cool design with some functionality

author: Ross Talbot
comment: I love this face, it's one of my favourites, but recently the year as part of the date is all over the place. Currently it's showing 2025. How do I adjust this??

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Ross,  The default date format is YY/MMM/DD, so it's probably showing 25 meaning the day not the year.  This can be change by going into the settings and changing the date format to a format of you liking.

comment: Was good until the option menu moved to the watch. Now it's a lot harder to change options on a small watch face

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello.  Thanks for your review. Based on user feedback we've improved the new watch menu to make it much easier  to use. Version 3.0.5 has been released today, so please watch out for it and let us know what you think.

author: Daniel Sirkett
comment: Best feature for me is ability to cycle through different data display options in both lower sub displays. Also excellent to have week number display for use in Sweden where this is universally used. Only gripe is that wind speed in mph. Don't see how to change to m/s which would be more consistent with metric display. Is there a way to do this (I have Sony Smartwatch 3) ? Thanks!

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Daniel,  Thanks for your review.  You can change the wind speed to be: MPH, KPH, Knots, M/S or Force.  You can change the settings by going to the Android Wear app on your phone, tapping the gear icon over the watch face.  Press menu and select settings.  Once you've change the settings, tap back and it will be send straight to the watch.

author: Manoj Bokil
comment: Hi there excellent watchable. Rating a 5 star but have a question? What's the value displayed at the top just above the am/pm display. Racked my brains but cannot figure that out. Please help. The.left side one is obviously the battery life remaining but can't make sense what the right side one is and neither is that customizable I think..correct?

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Manoj, thanks for your comments. The number on top right is your phone battery life.

author: Natalie Wright
comment: Great Watch face,love the design, and the amount of information displayed. However since android wear 2.0 came out a few weeks ago I cannot edit the settings or change the location, so the temperature is displayed incorrectly. Hope it's fixed soon!

author: Joshua Byrnes
comment: Really like the watch face. My only complaint thus far is that both weather sections change value randomly and I have to constantly reset them. I like having the temperature in weather 1, but it constantly changes to max temp at random. Just looked down and the weather 2 section had changed from forecast to something else as well. I like the watch face but I can see these constant resets being more trouble than they're worth down the road.  Also tried to submit a bug report through settings and got a bunch of lines of code and no option to actually bug rep this.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Joshua, this can happen if you change widgets on the watch and your phone is disconnected at the time. The phone holds the master copy of the settings which is resyncd every 5 mins.  As we move the watch face to 2.0, all settings will be on the watch in the future.  To fix this now, make sure your phone is connected when you flip the widgets.

author: Almond Ponge
comment: Pretty nice watch face, very useful features. However, it seems that the 'forecast widget' just seems to be poorly aligned alone, and it really does not look as presentable (at least on my moto 360).   A slightly bigger icon at least as big as the fonts for the temperature would probably fix this, along with a tad bit of spacing so it would not be cramped in the middle. Either that or just change the forecast to words altogether (at least for the forecast only setting). Not really sure how that would turn out either. Also, while there is an option to center the time, it does not seem to actually center it horizontally (the time is slightly off to the left). This happens with or without the seconds. The battery numbers are also oddly spaced it seems (maybe needs left/right align to icon).  If these are at least remedied, I would gladly give 5 stars.  For the future, more customizable color options are certainly appreciated. Maybe an option for just one widget would be great too.   Note: For Nougat users, just note that you would need to enable locations permissions from your phone as well as the watch for auto location weather to work.

author: Paul Clausen
comment: Looks lovely but the weather info is miles off the mark for my location. I tried auto and manual location etc. I emailed support a week ago but haven't heard back yet. It seems that the openweather system is just hopeless for South Australia.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content:
Hello Paul,

Thanks for your review - can you resend your email to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk as we've not seen it and we can investigate.  Many Thanks.

author: Dano Ragano
comment: Everything I need and customizable to my liking. A few quirks, I can't make the line spacers appear on my watch, can't stop interactive face from launching apps. Sometimes I'll look at my watch and it will be sitting on the weather.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Dano, you can disable to weather summary, together with many more settings via the Android Wear app on your phone.  Click on the gear icon over the watch face and press menu/settings.  If you need anymore help, drop us an email to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk

author: selene vazquez
comment: I bought it twice and uninstalled it once. However, I'm about to request a refund. I cannot seem to find the installation within the smart phone or the watch. Please someone help. The images seems cool and would hate to ask for the refund once again.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Selene,  the watch face should automatically transfer to the watch face. Once it does you will be able to access the settings for the app via Android Wear app on your phone. If you still have trouble the please drop us an email to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk.

author: James Magill
comment: This is not compatible with the LG G Watch R. When using the android wear app to search for watch faces this one is presented by Google. I loved the look of says it needs Android wear which I am running it was not till after the refund period that I found out this is not compatible.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello James,  Many thanks for your review.  The LG G Watch R is one of the watches that we test the watch face with to ensure that it is compatible before release, so not sure why it isn't working for you. Can you let us know what issues you are experiencing so that we can address them.  Please drop us an email to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk

author: SWANSON SWANSON
comment: App finally pushed through to the watch. For several reasons, this is by far my favorite watch face. Aesthetics, etc. Would love to have a heart rate widget with it.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hi Chris,  we're just in the process of testing a heart rate widget now for compatible devices - watch out for it soon!

author: Nathan Groon
comment: Great watch face, colors are customizable.  Only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the lack of precip chance/amount in the weather data

author: Jason Ioannou
comment: Loved this face on my SW3,  now have a Huawei Watch 2. This face is great but now I feel it could do with Heart Rate as one of the display options for Android Wear 2.0

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Jason, Thanks for your review - Heart rate and full Wear 2.0 support is on it's way; hopefully it will be out in Jan 18!

author: Julio Garcia
comment: Definitely worth the dollar and few cents. Liking it so far only needs to have the step counter for Moto health along with  heart activity and  total burned calories.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Julio,  We're in the process of testing a heart rate widget (for compatible devices) and will investigate adding calories soon.

author: Rob Ward
comment: For 95p This face has it all. Compared to the more expensive ones I would highly recommend this.  Very happy with this 👍*****

author: Kurt Jenney
comment: This is the best and most informative Android Wear watchface that I have found.  I keep looking for others that allow me to see both phone and watch batteries, temperature, and weather...but this is the only one!  Nice job on this app!  Could you make some other styles that allow that same functionality?

author: Thomas DeBell
comment: This face is awesome, but ever since Android Wear 2.0 came out, this no longer updates unless you open the app settings on the phone inside the phone's Android Wear app. No response from bug report. Hopefully fixed soon!

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Thomas,  Thanks for your bug report, we've replied to your email this morning.  We're aware of an issue affecting a small number of devices after they have been updated to Wear 2.0 - we're currently working out why it isn't working properly so we can fix it.

author: Austin Dovel
comment: This watch face has no settings. This means I can't change it from Celsius to ferrinheight and can't change it from a 24 hour clock. Also displaying weather is useless if you can't change the location. The time is unreadable to me and the temperature is unreadable to me and it's displaying weather for the wrong country forget about state

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Austin. Settings for the Watch face are available via the Android Wear app on your phone.  Click on the gear icon over the watch face to take you to settings.  Here you can validate your location is being correctly worked out.  If you continue to have issues, drop us an email to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk and we can assist you.

author: JUAN VAZQUEZ
comment: Inexistent costumer service. Bought the face but I cannot use all the features as it still say that I need to buy it, what is ridiculous.  Wrote to costumer service since days & no answer, hope they will see this review & find  it.  If no response, will apply reimbursement.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Juan, Thanks for getting in contact with us.  I can confirm that we replied to your email on Wednesday at 7:21pm UK time.  Please look out for the email - perhaps it might have been tagged as spam? If you haven't received it, let us know via here and we can resend it.  Many Thanks.

author: David Atkin
comment: Playstore shows watch as installed, but I cannot see it on my phone (Samsung A3 2016) or watch (Huawei). Both phone and watch have been reset. No success. Sent a email to you a week ago about this problem no response. Not happy.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hi David.  We've resent the emails as requested in your email - let us know when you get them.  Thanks.

author: quenton williams
comment: Weather doesn't work at just says no location even though the location given in the settings on my phone. Battery indicator for phone and watch are not in sync at all.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Quenton,  can you drop us an email to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk and we'll be able to assist you.

author: Mike Terry
comment: Simply amazing. Devs like this help the world go around!

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Thanks for the review Mike

author: Paul Hitch
comment: Hi I have just purchased this and my phone (s8+) says it has successfully installed yet I cannot find it anywhere? Any ideas?

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Paul.  Many thanks for your email.  We've replied with our PDF installation guide, please let us know if you need any more information.

author: Jeff Ambrose
comment: Doesnt work on note 8 . Wear app doesnt see it

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Jeff,  Can you drop us an email to support@wearabledesigns.co.uk and we can assist you.

author: Giorgos Vergis
comment: Great look many options to customize it all the information I need all on my screen will give it 5 stars once I see how much battery drain it causes

author: Marco Mendoza
comment: Looks great, but there are a bug on Moto 360 Sport 2nd Gen, often the amount of steps are not displayed inclusive if it is switched between other faces.

reply.author: Wearable Designs
reply.content: Hello Marco. Can you drop us an email and we can explain the issue surrounding your Step count.  You can select "Google Fit" as the step count source and this will give you a good value.
